item.description:
The Head Pond Rail Trail in Hooksett is a flat, wide trail most of the way. . There are a few places off trail along the way the dogs can access the water. There is a pond at the turn around point where the dogs can swim if it isn't iced over.  As this is a line hike (you come back the exact same way) on a easy to follow mostly straight trail any one getting to cold or tired before we reach the turn around point can easily find their way back to the parking lot.

  Be aware that the third house down the trail has 2 vicious dogs with an electric fence but they can reach within 2 feet of the trail.  Fortunately that house is very near the start of the hike and won't take long to get past if the dogs are outside.  

This should be an easy hike for most people unless walking 4 miles is an issue for you.  Snow on the ground would make walking take more effort unless it is packed down.  If it is packed down it could be slippery at times.  In that case traction devices for your footwear and/or hiking poles could help prevent you from falling.  This trail is hiked year round.
item.how_to_find_us: The parking lot for the trail head is at the intersection of Rte. 3 (Hooksett Rd.) and Post Rd near (almost opposite) Green's Marine

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Head Pond - Rail Trail Line Hike (2 miles 1 way - 4 miles round trip)
